hard_constraints.description: The relation of proper divisibility is formally established such that for any integer N within the specified domain, an integer M is identified as a proper divisor if N is non-identical to M and the remainder of the division of N by M is equal to zero.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: divisor(M, N) :- num(N), num(M), N!=M, N\M==0.

hard_constraints.description: The property of being a perfect number is predicated upon the condition that for any integer N, the arithmetic summation of the set of its proper divisors M is quantitatively equivalent to N.
